a.assets: A company's articles set out its rules. The articles form part of the memorandum and articles of association.

b.bear: A bear is someone who expects share prices to fall in the future and sells shares now so that they can buy them back later at a lower price.

c.capital gain: You make a capital gain if you sell or dispose of a longâˆ’term asset (such as a building) for more than it cost you.
